task: Create Resource Inventory for Your Project
description: Catalog all tools, commands, workflows, and scripts in your project. Compare against orchestrator's master index to identify missing items.
prerequisite: Orchestrator must complete Phase 1 first. Check orchestrator-communication.json: aggregation.phase must be 'phase_2_agents_inventory' before starting.

instructions.step_1: IDENTIFY your role and output_file from agent-communication.json agents[] array (find your agent_id)
instructions.step_2: SCAN your project directory (agent_path) for: MCP tools (if MCP server), slash commands (.claude/commands/), workflows (documented processes), scripts (*.py, *.js, *.sh), utilities (helper tools)
instructions.step_3: READ orchestrator-master-index.md to see what's already documented in reference site
instructions.step_4: CREATE inventory at your output_file path with: Resources You Have (categorized list), Missing from Master (items in your project NOT in orchestrator's master index), Notes (context about your resources)
instructions.step_5: UPDATE agent-communication.json: Find your entry in agents[] array, set your status='complete', increment aggregation.completed by 1

output_template:
# {Agent ID} Resource Inventory

## Resources You Have

### MCP Tools (if applicable)
- **tool_name**: Description, parameters, use case

### Slash Commands
- **/command-name**: Description, when to use

### Workflows
- **workflow-name**: Description, steps, triggers

### Scripts
- **script-name.py**: Description, usage, location

### Utilities
- **utility-name**: Description, functionality

---

## Missing from Master Index
(Items you have that are NOT in orchestrator-master-index.md)

### Category
- **missing_item**: Description, why it's valuable

---

## Notes
- Any context about your resources
- Dependencies between tools
- Usage patterns
- Future enhancements

quality_standards.completeness: All tools, commands, workflows, scripts, and utilities documented. Accurate comparison against master index.
quality_standards.accuracy: Exact names, correct descriptions, valid file paths. No placeholders or guesses.
quality_standards.format: Markdown with clear sections. Bulleted lists. Bold resource names. Consistent structure across all agents.

important_notes: DO NOT assume orchestrator role - you are an individual agent inventorying YOUR project only
READ orchestrator-master-index.md before creating your inventory to identify gaps
UPDATE agent-communication.json after completing your output
Your output_file path is specified in agent-communication.json agents[] array
